sub_title: Commercial Outreach Officer at the MSC
summary:
My name is Nils Kroon, and I have been fascinated with nature and the involvement of humans with nature for as long as I can remember. Due to this fascination, I have become very aware of the necessary steps that are needed to find the balance between an economically feasible activity and the acceptance of such an activity, when considering values like sustainability. For me, this has resulted in a continuous curiousity about how such a balance can be achieved and how to promote associated socio-economic and ecological benefits.

During my attendance at the Bachelor's Coastal and Marine Management, I have been focused on understanding how the human-nature relationship can take place in more sustainable ways for multiple industries that rely on the coastal and marine environment for transportation, and recreational and exploitative purposes. This was when I discovered my interest in the fishing industry and the ever-continuing developments and challenges this industry faces. Through the last few years, I have attended multiple courses and performed projects in the fields of marine governance, marine resource management, marine biology and ecology. Among other things, these projects have taught me that more sustainable fishing practices can take place in the most effective way when fisheries management is based on a collaborative approach with the fishing industry. This approach is complemented by a consensus on the meaning and value of sustainability, and the principle that the efforts that the industry are taking will be noticed and (where needed) compensated.

My intention is to help explore the possibilities to reach more sustainable fishing practices and to improve the processes that lead to such a result. Challenges are the precursor to growth, and I never let myself be restricted by what I do not know yet!

school.name: Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences
Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences
Jan van Egmond Lyceum - PSG Purmerend

profile_positions.description:
During this internship, I have spent most time on a research project that considered the involvement of stakeholders in the Pre-Assessment stage of fisheries. Quantitative and qualitative research was conducted on how fishery-specific characteristics affected this involvement and how this could have provided value to a fishery's sustainable progress and certification probability.

Upon request, I also aided the MSC with other activities by supporting the licensing team, performing data inventory, supporting on data management and attending conventions.
profile_positions.title: Standards & Research and Outreach Intern

profile_positions.description: As Unibuddy, I am assisting prospective students of the master's Aquaculture and Marine Resource Management. Via the chat of Wageningen University and Research, I provide answers to all questions that are related to student life, application requirements, housing, scholarships, etc.
profile_positions.title: Unibuddy/Ambassador of MSc Aquaculture and Marine Resource Management

profile_positions.description:
As student assistant of the BSc course Introduction to Environmental Sciences, I was responsible for the supervision of 9 BSc students that had to perform their first scientific research project. The supervision mostly consisted of teaching the value of informational literacy, how to clearly substantiate and present research results and how to ensure an efficient project process with a group.
Feedback was also given on presentation skills, and intermediary and final research products.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

profile_positions.description: During the ACT course of my Master's program, I managed a project with a team of 7 international students. We provided Arcadis with more insight in the ecological effects of offshore windfarm cable laying activities in the North Sea. As manager, I was responsible for chairing the meetings, planning the project processes, communicating with the commissioner, guiding the team towards decisions and ensuring that everyone could perform their work effectively.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager - Academic Consultancy Training

profile_positions.description:
During this period, I was working in the form of a combined role. Most of my time was spent on making sure the financial processes, on a large amount of customer accounts from multiple European countries, were proceeding as intended. 
The remaining time was spent on providing support on technical projects that were aimed at improving the customer experience and efficiency of daily tasks.
profile_positions.title: Financial Assistant/Operations Supporter

profile_positions.description: During this period, I was responsible for the financial processes of customers that made use of Retail items. My time was spent on making sure the transactions, on more than 250 customer accounts from multiple European countries, were proceeding as intended.
profile_positions.title: Junior Financial Assistant
